speaker: CHRIS CARTER
line: Previously, on the X-Files...

speaker: SUSANNE MODESKI
line: My name is Susanne Modeski... I was an organic chemist for the Advanced Weapons Facility... I need to expose the US government's plot against its own people.

speaker: MODESKI
line: Tell the truth. Reach as many people as you can with it, that's your weapon.

speaker: BYERS
line: Susanne!

speaker: BYERS
line: My name is John Fitzgerald Byers. I was named after our 35th president, and I keep having this beautiful dream. In my dream, the events of November 22nd, 1963, never happened. In it, my namesake was never assassinated. Other things are different, too, in my dream. My country is hopeful and innocent; young again. Young in spirit. My fellow citizens trust their elect officials, never once having been betrayed by them. My government is truly "of the people, by the people, for the people." All my hopes for my country, for myself...all are fulfilled. Everything that counts for anything in life... I have it. But the dream ends the same way every time. I lose it all.

speaker: SHUFFLING MAN
line: The game is Texas Hold 'Em, gentlemen.

speaker: GLASSES MAN
line: Bring your wife?

speaker: BALD MAN
line: You think I'm sitting here, I'd bring my wife? Dumb ass brought his wife.

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: 'Cause I'm the man; I say I'm playing poker, I play poker. Meanwhile, your wife is back in Plaino, boinking the mailman.

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: Hey, what's your name again?

speaker: BYERS
line: Funston. Stewart Funston.

speaker: BALD MAN
line: You bring a little lady, Stewart?

speaker: BYERS
line: Not married.

speaker: GLASSES MAN
line: Smart man, hundred.

speaker: BYERS
line: You's guys come to this every year? Def-con?

line: Every year. Ah, fold.

line: Wouldn't miss it.

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: Yeah. Out!

line: Same old black ops crapola. You know what it's like.

speaker: GLASSES MAN
line: Hey, we're doing some neat stuff with neutron bombardment. Yeah, you can cook somebody's brain in their skull, like hard-boiling an egg.

speaker: GLASSES MAN
line: It's neat stuff.

line: Speaking of crapola...... fold.

speaker: SHUFFLING MAN
line: Thank you.

line: Oh... a man of distinction.

line: So you in, Mr. Funston?

line: Yeah.

line: Looks like it's just you and me.

speaker: BYERS
line: Another 200.

speaker: SHUFFLING MAN
line: I'll see your 200...... and raise you one...... thousand.

speaker: BALD MAN
line: Huh whoa!

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: He's buying the pot stew.

speaker: BALD MAN
line: Three clubs showing... could be a flush.

speaker: BYERS
line: One thousand. And I raise you...... one thousand.

speaker: GLASSES MAN
line: The stones he has...

speaker: SHUFFLING MAN
line: I see you work for Conglomerate. You guys make a great AE-135 unit.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Oh man... don't freak... don't...

speaker: LANGLY
line: ...freak. I'm on it. AE-135...mmmm...bingo. 442 J-stroke, A-135 air conditioning units for B-2 bombers. Talk air conditioners.

speaker: BYERS
line: Oh yeah, the AE-135 is a beauty. Keeps the B-2's frosty, can practically see your breath.

speaker: SHUFFLING MAN
line: How'd you get all the bugs out of it?

speaker: BYERS
line: Ah, you know, trade secrets.

speaker: SHUFFLING MAN
line: Oh, come on, Stewart. You're among friends. Seriously, how'd you get past the delamination thing?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Delamination... searching.

speaker: SHUFFLING MAN
line: Oh, uh, I'm sorry. I'll see your thousand...... and raise you...... all you've got.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Systems tests, error rates... nothing. Stall 'em. And fold.

speaker: ((NEONOTE
line: Langly's t-shirt of the episode; Snoozonica) Cut back to the private suite.)

speaker: BYERS
line: You wanna know how we fixed the delamination problem? We subcontracted the whole damn thing to the Japanese, then triple-billed the government. Same thing we always do. Queen-high flush.

speaker: SHUFFLING MAN
line: King-high. Al, call security. Have them pick up Mr. "Funston" here. And his partner.

line: Delamination... you made that up?

speaker: SHUFFLING MAN
line: My advice to you, Stewart, or whatever your name really is, poker is not your game.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hey man, you wanna thunderdome, let's go.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Three thousand dollars... I told you to fold. It should have been me in there playing, why does Byers get to do the undercover?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: 'Cause this ain't Woodstock.

speaker: BYERS
line: Did we at least get some usable prints off the drink glasses?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What, are you kidding? We had to leave them all behind. How we gonna salvage this?

line: We're not. This convention's a bust. Five days and three grand invested and we got bupkiss to show for it.

line: Who was that player, anyway? The guy who made us, he wasn't wearing a convention badge.

line: Nobody ever said his name.

line: I think he's worth looking into.

line: CIA, open up.

line: Hey, hey, hey. Jimmy and Timmy.

line: Hey. Where were you guys today?

line: Around.

line: Oh yeah? Maybe snooping for some hot 411?

line: On the sneak tip?

line: Maybe...

line: Yeah, well maybe we were too.

speaker: JIMMY
line: And maybe we got some.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Well maybe we did too.

speaker: JIMMY
line: Ah, we got bupkiss. Buncha tight lipped defense contractors.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Yeah, well I'm gonna go way out on a limb here and say, it's the t-shirt.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Yeah, maybe both of you could wear one that says "I'm with stupid."

speaker: JIMMY
line: You just don't get it, man. This says that I'm on to them. This says that I comprehend the military industrial power dynamic. That's what this whole thing is about; wetworks, political assassination. That's their theme for this year.

line: Where did you hear that?

speaker: JIMMY
line: Oh yeah, like I'm gonna reveal my sources. Suffice it to say, there's some big new stealth assassination technology that's supposed to be unveiled here. And I will be there, front row.

speaker: TIMMY
line: In the meantime, we're hitting the restaurant.

speaker: JIMMY
line: Yeah, all you can eat lobster buffet.

speaker: TIMMY
line: Free floor show... plenty of boobage. You guys down?

speaker: BYERS
line: You go ahead.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: I'll catch up.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: You're one hell of a sad-sack, Byers.

speaker: BYERS
line: Lay off about the poker game.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: No, that's not what I'm talking about. You're the one who pushes the hardest for us to come to these conventions, then you get all squirrelly once we get here. You're still looking for her, aren't you? Susanne Modeski.

speaker: BYERS
line: We met her at a convention.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Ten years ago. In Baltimore. Now we both know what happened to her. Most likely, she's dead.

speaker: BYERS
line: No. She was a brilliant scientist, too important to the government.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Buddy, either way, I know we're both hoping she's in a better place than Las Vegas. C'mon. All you can eat lobster.

speaker: BYERS
line: I almost won.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Yeah, you and everyone else. Whoa, Byers, check this out. I'm feeling lucky.

speaker: BYERS
line: It can't be.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What?

speaker: BYERS
line: I'm so sorry. I'm sorry.

line: Byers... what the hell's going on?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, Scully.

line: Hey, Scully, it's me.

line: Mulder, what time is it?

speaker: MULDER'S VOICE
line: 2:34AM. Listen, Scully, I need you on the next flight to Las Vegas.

line: Las Vegas? Why?

line: It's the Lone Gunmen. They're onto something big.

line: What, exactly?

speaker: MULDER'S VOICE
line: It's really important. Trust me.

line: Yeah, I trust you, Mulder, it's the Three Stooges I'm not so sure about.

line: Look, I can't talk over an unsecured line. Please just get here. It's an emergency.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. Okay, okay. Okay.

line: What if she calls him back?

speaker: BYERS
line: I trapped her cell number. If she calls him, it rings here.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: She's gonna kick our ass. What do you need Scully for, anyway?

speaker: BYERS
line: We're up against agents of the government. We need our own government agent.

speaker: LANGLY
line: And that would be Mulder. Why do you want just Scully?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: She's gonna kick our ass.

speaker: BYERS
line: Mulder's too high profile. He's virtually a household name to the black ops who kidnapped Susanne in Baltimore.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Byers, I've hacked into the hotel computers, Susanne Modeski's not registered here. Are you sure you saw her; are you absolutely, positively sure?

speaker: BYERS
line: It was her. She's here. I've got to find her!

speaker: FROHIKE
line: You've gotta find some ice, you need a drink.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Byers is trying to kill himself.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Stop trying to kill yourself, Byers, it's not deep enough. Come see what we got. Room 1066, registered to our mystery poker player, one Grant Ellis. New Mexico plates on his car.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Which come back listed "DoD motor pool." Signed out from...

speaker: BYERS
line: Whitestone, New Mexico.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: The advanced army weapons facility. Where Susanne worked.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Ellis's credit cards get billed directly to the Administrative Offices. He's looking like he's some kind of shadow government "poobah."

speaker: BYERS
line: He brainwashed her.

speaker: BYERS
line: Well that's what they do there! The AH gas she developed. Call it psychological warfare, behavior modification, but it's all about mind control. And undoubtedly, the process has been refined in the last decade. She ran from them, refused to take part in their tests, their crimes against the American people, there's no way she would choose to be working for them now, working for that guy...... kissing him. Clearly he brainwashed her.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: I know a way to find out.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Buenos dias.

line: I can't get into the conference. The guard who threw me out is working the door.

line: Let me go.

speaker: JIMMY
line: CIA, freeze.

speaker: LANGLY
line: That just keeps getting funnier. Where's your girlfriend, Timmy?

speaker: JIMMY
line: Ah, out in the desert. There's this naked chick who'll teach you how to shoot machine guns. It costs 200 beans though, I told him he was a putz. What's the matter, Byers? Your bestest dog die? What's up?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Trying to figure out how to get into the Saguaro Room.

line: Good luck. That's the Holy Grail. Bug sweeps...

line: Casino security outside, government security inside. There's no way any of us are getting in.

line: I can get in there. And I will, too. When the time is right.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Doo-doo, kaa-kaa, poo-poo.

speaker: JIMMY
line: Oh, go brush your hair, Michael Bolton. There's a hole in their security, I've got it all figured out. But there's nothing worth hearing in there until tomorrow, when they unveil their new assassination technology.

line: Again with the assassination technology.

speaker: BYERS
line: I need to get in there, Jimmy. I need to know what's happening in there today. If you can really get in there, prove it.

speaker: ELLIS
line: .... in combat can be established. Now, if you'll take a look at the kill ratio productivity chart we've provided for you and turn to... page 22 there... you'll see that we've experienced a marked...

speaker: JIMMY
line: Oooh, there's your fascist chickie, Byers.

speaker: ELLIS
line: ... first and second quarterly periods of the previous year. But, before we're tempted to pat ourselves on the back for this we have to remember these figures...

speaker: JIMMY
line: Timmy? Damn...

speaker: ELLIS
line: .... the current operations in Bagdad. These operations, originally budgeted for fiscal year '97, were... if you'll refer to page 26, I believe...

speaker: JIMMY
line: Oh, woah, woah! Hey, hold on! Hold on!

speaker: JIMMY
line: You're one of them...

speaker: TIMMY
line: You really screwed things up, Jimmy.

line: We had big plans for you.

line: Big plans?

speaker: JIMMY
line: Political assassination. I was right. I was right about the whole thing!

line: Every good plan needs a patsy.

line: Sure.

line: Agent Scully.

line: He's, uh, I think that his phone's messed up.

line: He may be hard to reach for the next few hours, he suggested we work with you, bring you up to speed.

line: By all means, bring me up to speed.

line: nan

line: Subject's name is James Bellmont, over. This way.

line: Oh, man. Jimmy.

line: He just jumped; no warning, no nothing. He just, dived right out in front of me.

line: Oh, God, it is Jimmy.

speaker: BUS DRIVER
line: It's not my fault. He was just standing there, and then he just dives under the bus.

line: This wasn't a suicide.

line: You know this man?

line: What's going on here?

speaker: BYERS
line: Susanne, do you remember me?

speaker: MODESKI
line: John, what are you doing here?

speaker: BYERS
line: I'm here to save you.

speaker: MODESKI
line: From what?

speaker: BYERS
line: I don't think you are yourself. I think that, uh, you've been mistreated and confused, and, and, I'm afraid that your, your beliefs, your opinions, are no longer your own.

speaker: MODESKI
line: As in, I've been brainwashed? I don't know what to tell you. I haven't been.

speaker: BYERS
line: Your life may be in danger, Susanne. A friend of mine has just been killed. Murdered.

speaker: MODESKI
line: What?

speaker: BYERS
line: And that man that you're with...

speaker: MODESKI
line: My fiance?

speaker: MODESKI
line: I'm sorry John, I, I think you better go.

speaker: BYERS
line: No, wait. Wait. Ten years ago, I saw you thrown into a car. Kidnapped right in front of me. Did that not happen? Did I just dream all of that?

speaker: MODESKI
line: It happened. But things got better.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Oops. Sorry, buddy.

line: That Susanne's a popular girl.

line: You're absolutely sure you wanna be here for this?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Oh yeah. I'm cool. Let's just find out what killed him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: James Bellmont, age 29. Visual exam reveals injuries consistent with massive trauma. Multiple rib fractures with concomgent haemorrhaging, both internal and external. His spine is fractured and partially exposed.

speaker: LANGLY
line: What if "they" did something to him? You know, to make him pancake himself?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who's "they?"

speaker: LANGLY
line: You know, "them."

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll begin with the Y-incision.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Langly, will you go over there and pass me the striker saw please, it's right there on the counter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you okay, Langly?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Scully?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Scully. Wake up. Are you okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened?

speaker: LANGLY
line: I'm thinking that you got a little queasy and took a header. You know blood and guts can bother some people.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I guess.

speaker: LANGLY
line: You gonna be alright?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sure, cutie.

speaker: LANGLY
line: So... you're done with Jimmy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Done, done, done. How do you roll this thing?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Uhhhm, Scully? What killed him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: My medical opinion? BEEEEEEEEEEEEEEP!

speaker: LANGLY
line: And that's all you found?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's all I know.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Scully?

speaker: BYERS
line: What'd you find out?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Autopsy was negatory. Jimmy squished himself.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: And where is the scrumptious Agent Scully?

speaker: LANGLY
line: She said she had something important to do. Man, she is seriously jetlagged. You got product already?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: No, an earlier bird got the worm.

speaker: MODESKI ON TAPE
line: ...it's like they're keeping tabs on us, watching us.

speaker: ELLIS ON TAPE
line: Honey, you worry too much. The plan is still on schedule. Everything's falling into place. We've worked so long and so hard for this.

speaker: BYERS
line: It's not her. They're making her do this somehow.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Buddy, now, I know something about the fairer sex. Trust me, you can bring a horse to water, but you can't make her drink.

speaker: BYERS
line: She would not marry that man.

speaker: MODESKI
line: You don't know him like I do.

speaker: LANGLY
line: How'd you get in here?

speaker: MODESKI
line: One of you left this in my room.

speaker: MODESKI
line: Grant Ellis saved my life. He's saved the lives of thousands.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hah.

speaker: MODESKI
line: I need to talk to you, John, I need to try and explain everything.

speaker: LANGLY
line: C'mon, let's hit the slots.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Watch your back. Mata Hari.

speaker: MODESKI
line: You said something about a friend being murdered.

speaker: BYERS
line: Not that I can prove it. But I think he saw something he was not supposed to see at your conference. You may be in danger.

speaker: MODESKI
line: I am. Always. So is Grant. I've thought about this moment so many times. All the things I would say to you if I ever saw you again. And then there you were, at my door, and I... They took me ten years ago. They did things to me. And it was like drowning every day; under water, struggling to breathe, and one day, a hand broke the surface, reached down and pulled me up. I wanted it to be you, John. It was Grant. He worked for them on The Project. I didn't trust him, not for years. Not until I realized that he was working against them in his own way; stalling them, sabotaging their tests. He reminded me of you.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: They're just lucky I got a conscience.

speaker: LANGLY
line: How's that?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: If I unleashed my true kung-fu on this casino, I could break the bank within a week.

speaker: LANGLY
line: And find yourself buried under six feet of desert dirt.

speaker: TIMMY
line: Hey guys.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hey Timmy. I'm sorry about Jimmy.

speaker: TIMMY
line: Hey, Langly, the guys are all up in my room for a round of Dungeons and Dragons in honor of Jimmy.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Lord Manhammer will be in attendance.

speaker: LANGLY
line: I'm gonna go play a little D&D, uh, in memorium.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: That's touching, man.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Aw, hey. Long time, no see.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, that's not nice. I like Hickey.

speaker: FLETCHER
line: Cigarette?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: You don't smoke.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But who's got a match?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well... I just can't decide who lights my fire.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: That's it. Alright, you dandies, back off. This is Special Agent Dana Scully of the FBI. If you so much as touch her, you may be committing a federal offense. Come on, come on.

speaker: FLETCHER
line: We could have been stardust.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe next time.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Hope you brought your wallet, my friend, just because this is a memorial...... game. What's this?

speaker: TIMMY
line: Oh, we have got a game for you.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Man...

speaker: ELLIS ON TAPE
line: Trust me, this is gonna work.

speaker: MODESKI
line: You didn't tape this?

speaker: BYERS
line: No.

speaker: MODESKI
line: Which means they surveilled us. They know our plans, they know everything.

speaker: BYERS
line: What is your plan?

speaker: MODESKI
line: To escape. This conference was our chance to slip out on the last day. Go public with our files, all our weapons research. We could finally make it happen this time. We'd gathered up enough proof. The public is ready to believe now more than ever. They know everything. They'll kill us, John; Grant and me both.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Settle down, settle down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, okay, okay, okay.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: I found Agent Scully-go-lightly holding court...... bar!

speaker: BYERS
line: I've never seen her drunk before...

speaker: MODESKI
line: God, this can't be.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi...

speaker: MODESKI
line: She's not drunk, look at this.

speaker: MODESKI
line: That was made by an injector gun.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Well, what the hell was she injected with?!

speaker: MODESKI
line: It's derivative of AH gas. AH, anoitic histamine, my latest creation. I could have developed it years ago, but I held off. I wasn't about to let those bastards I work for get their hands on it. Grant thought that if we secretly developed a small batch, and then destroyed the notes, that we would have the proof we needed to go public. We'd also have a weapon we could use against them.

speaker: BYERS
line: Who else has access to this anoitic histamine?

speaker: MODESKI
line: Grant and I are the only two people that ha...... that have the samples.

speaker: MODESKI
line: This will counteract the anoitic effect.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi, cutie. Oow... just a little prick...

speaker: LANGLY
line: Bad trip?

speaker: MODESKI
line: Nah, she'll be fine. She just needs to sleep it off.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: I don't understand; why would the government want to turn Scully into a bimbo?

speaker: MODESKI
line: That's just a potential side-effect. Anoitic histamine impedes higher brain functions. It promotes suggestability.

speaker: BYERS
line: Mind control. Brainwashing.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: That explains Jimmy. They told him to commit suicide.

speaker: BYERS
line: And Scully. They made her forget her autopsy findings. But what is their larger purpose? What are they planning?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Well, whatever it is, we better find out fast.

speaker: TIMMY
line: Right on time.

speaker: TIMMY
line: This is your weapon. All you do is pull the trigger. You will a break will be called. Rise, approach the target, and fire three shots.

speaker: SPEAKER
line: This brings us to the notion of acceptable risk. Of course, risk is defined as exposure, during both utilization and post-project evaluation. Now in a secure proving-ground, i.e. a domestic engagement, we have had great success. Now off-shore utilizations can afford a more comprehensive definition of acceptable risk. Proper target appraisal can provide a risk-free trial environment. A combination of political instability and lack of efficient infrastructure can offer a, uh, target area of nearly zero risk potential.

speaker: SAGUARO ROOM GUARD
line: Authorized attendees only.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm an FBI agent.

speaker: SAGUARO ROOM GUARD
line: Authorized attendees.

speaker: SPEAKER
line: Of course, risk management goes hand-in-hand with operational preparedness, and that happens to be our topic for the remainder of the session...

speaker: ELLIS
line: Al, I think this would be a good time to take a break, shall we?

speaker: SPEAKER
line: Oh, yeah. Let's take five everybody. Smoke 'em if ya got 'em.

line: Oh my God.

line: Somebody help her...somebody...!

speaker: ELLIS
line: Susanne...

line: Federal agent. Call for help.

line: Winston Warbler, we need an ambulance, a woman's been shot.

speaker: SAGUARO ROOM GUARD
line: She's bleeding, hurry.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: We're on our way.

speaker: ELLIS
line: Who did this? Who did this!?

line: Shooter got away. Detain this man, get him outta here.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Good work, party girl.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll take him from here.

speaker: ELLIS
line: Wait a minute, where... where... where're you taking me?

speaker: ELLIS
line: Susanne?

speaker: MODESKI
line: Can we have a moment, alone, please? I'll be fine.

speaker: BYERS
line: We'll be right down the hall.

speaker: MODESKI
line: Okay.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Thanks for the tip.

speaker: MODESKI
line: Big surprise, huh? Since you programmed my friend to kill me.

speaker: ELLIS
line: No, Susanne, it wasn't my idea.

speaker: MODESKI
line: You knew about it. You gave it to them. The AH. If I hadn't thought to check Langly, if I hadn't given him the antidote...... I don't understand. Why save me? Why save my life just to take it away?

speaker: ELLIS
line: You know why.

speaker: MODESKI
line: You were done with me. You had what you wanted.

speaker: ELLIS
line: "They" had what they wanted. The project was over. Honest to God, it wasn't my idea.

speaker: MODESKI
line: All those years you spent gaining my trust. You pretended that you loved me. What could they possibly give you for that? What was it worth to you, Grant? What was your price? What did you get!

speaker: ELLIS
line: Life. They'd kill me.

speaker: TIMMY
line: Hello.

speaker: ELLIS
line: I'm so sorry, Susanne.

speaker: BYERS
line: County death records first, then the state tax rolls, come on! Then the Clark County Morgue list that they misplaced the body.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Yeah, Voltaire comidant. Why don't you just zap me with the girly sting there and brainwash me again.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: I say do it, then we can make him cut his hair.

speaker: BYERS
line: Can you answer that?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Why me, she's your little chickadee.

speaker: BYERS
line: Hurry up, come on.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Come on in, Mata Hari.

speaker: TIMMY
line: CIA, freeze.

speaker: BYERS
line: Let her go.

speaker: TIMMY
line: Sure...

speaker: BYERS
line: No...

speaker: TIMMY
line: You know the best thing about killing you three... I won't have to dress like you anymore...

speaker: BYERS
line: Oh, get him off me.

speaker: TIMMY
line: Hi, cutie...

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What do ya wanna do with him?

speaker: REPORTER
line: Police confirm an arrest has been made, this man Timothy Landau of Aldonaberta, New Mexico, has confessed to the murders of Grant Ellis and Susanne Modeski. Both victims were government employees attending a conference in Las Vegas.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello, Mulder? Can you hear me? I'm at the hotel. Where are you? What do you mean, "what hotel," Las Vegas. I'm in Las Vegas, aren't you? You called me. What do you mean you didn't call me? Oh man, I am gonna kick their asses.

speaker: BYERS
line: Susanne Modeski is dead. Every computer in every county, state, federal office knows it. This is who you are now.

speaker: MODESKI
line: Come with me.

speaker: BYERS
line: You'll be safer without me.

speaker: MODESKI
line: It doesn't make a difference. I told you, I'm going public.

speaker: BYERS
line: No, you're not. You've done more than enough. Leave it to us now, it's what we do.

speaker: MODESKI
line: It was meant for Grant. I want you to have it.

speaker: MODESKI
line: Someday.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: So you wanna hit the slots?

speaker: LANGLY
line: You know, Byers, growing old with us ain't so bad.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Oh, shut up, Langly. You really want him to kill himself?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Got any quarters?
